FuncDef:
The test-failtimes command sets the threshold for the number of consecutive failures of an NQA trace test instance. Once this threshold is reached, a trap is sent to the NMS.
The undo test-failtimes command restores the default threshold for the number of consecutive failures of an NQA trace test instance.
By default, an NQA test instance sends a trap message for each test failure.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of consecutive failures of an NQA test.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 15.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A probe is a process in which a probe packet is sent in a test.
Multiple packets can be sent in a test. That is, a test can contain several probes. By default, a test is considered as a success if one or more probes in the test succeed; a test is considered failed if all probes in the test fail.
After the test-failtimes command is executed for an NQA test instance, traps will be sent only when send-trap is enabled.
Precautions
When the test-failtimes command is executed to change the value of times for a running test instance, the system prompts you whether to terminate the test instance. Press "Y" or "N" as required.
If you press "Y", the test instance is terminated, and the value of times is changed. The setting takes effect after the commit command is executed. To restart the test instance, run the start command.If you press "N", the test instance keeps running, and the value of times fails to be changed.
